{"step_by_step_thinking": "The cavernous sinus contains several important structures. According to Document [15], the structures passing through each cavernous sinus are: the internal carotid artery, and the abducent nerve [VI]. Structures in the lateral wall of each cavernous sinus are, from superior to inferior: the oculomotor nerve [III], the trochlear nerve [IV], the ophthalmic nerve [V1], and the maxillary nerve [V2]. Therefore, all the options are correct.", "answer_choice": "A, B, C, D"}
